hive_text_custom.text: : Okay. So Sarah, I see you eat soup every day at work. Why are you eating soup every day?
: That’s because I love to cook soup.
: Yes, it’s very easy to make.
: So you cook it and then you just bring it to work everyday?
: Yeah. I just make a lot on Monday and then I bring it to work everyday of the week.
: Oh nice. So how do you make the soup? What’s your secret?

: Well, I like to cook very easy. So I buy meat that’s already cut up, usually, chicken and then some rice, usually brown rice and then I buy some vegetables. So after I bought the ingredients, I chop them up and I put them all together in water until boils and add some
: Okay. So you say the water boils, so as soon as the water boils that’s when you put in all the ingredients?
: So you don’t put in the
: No. I guess, it’s just easier for the water to be hot because then the vegetables and the meat cook a little faster.
: So how do you give the soup flavoring?
: I usually add salt and pepper, maybe some garlic. And depending on the type of soup, either maybe some soy sauce or lemon juice.
: Okay. Do you put in the flavoring after you put in the ingredients or before you put in the ingredients?
: Maybe after but usually, right about all at the same time.
: So I just put everything in at one time.
: And then after you cook the soup, do you put the soup in the refrigerator? Do you let it sit outside?
: I usually eat some right then, and I also put it in
in the containers out on the counter for a while for it to cool before I put in the refrigerator.
: All right. And so, you don’t put it in the refrigerator until it is cool?
: Okay, nice. And then how do you
? Do you heat it up in a pot or do you heat it up in the microwave?
: In the microwave. It’s the easiest.
: Yeah. Nice. So you make enough for five meals?
: Maybe, sometimes. If I think I will
eating it during the week then maybe I’ll just make enough for three or four meals. But if it’s some kind that I think is really delicious and I know I want to eat it everyday, then I’ll make a lot.
: Well, if that happens, when you make the soup, you can make it for six or seven and give me a bowl.
: Okay. I’ll do that next time.

hive_lesson_quiz.question: 1)  She cooks the soup and _____ work.
4) She lets it sit until it _____ .
5) She usually makes enough for _____ bowls.

hive_text_custom.text: Seasoning is spices and flavors added to food. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
This soup needs more seasoning.
 Do you add seasoning?

hive_text_custom.text: You don’t put in the ingredients before the water boils.
Ingredients are the food items you add to food. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
What ingredients are in the soup?
 We only use fresh ingredients.

hive_text_custom.text: I put it in containers for the week.
Here, a container is a box with a lid that holds items. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Put the food in the containers. 
 I do not like to use plastic containers.

hive_text_custom.text: I let it sit in the containers
When you let some food sit, you leave it out before you eat it or put it in the refrigerator. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Let the soup sit and cool for awhile.
 If you let it sit too long, it will get cold.

hive_text_custom.text: How do you heat it up?
You heat up food to make it warm enough to eat. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Are you hungry? I can heat up some chili.
 It takes just minutes to heat up in the microwave.

hive_text_custom.text: I will get tired of eating it .
When you get tired of doing something, you do not want to do it anymore. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
I am getting tired of waiting.
 On my diet, I got tired of eating lettuce every day.
